item.title: Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Reveals In-Game Bonuses for Playing Zelda Games
item.description:
Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment has revealed a pair of bonuses that players of prior Zelda games can pick up in-game for free. Those who have save data from The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom or Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity on their Nintendo Switch 2 will be able to access two special weapons in Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment .

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment serves as a follow-up to both Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity and The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom . Players can expect the same general style of gameplay as they experienced in Hyrule Warriors , but the main story of the game will be canonical, serving to further detail the story of Zelda 's time spent in the ancient past.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment Bonus Weapons

With Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment approaching its release date, the game has revealed what players of prior Zelda games will be able to get in the title. Those who have a save file from The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom will receive a weapon called the High Guard's Sword. Save files from Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity will instead unlock the High Guard's Claymore. Both weapons will be available after players complete a mission called The Howling Tempest and return to the Hyrule map.

Hyrule Warriors has been a successful venture for Nintendo and Koei Tecmo, blending the characters and existing lore of the long-running Zelda universe with the gameplay of Dynasty Warriors . While the first entry originally launched on the ill-fated Wii U, it saw enough success that it was ported to the more popular Nintendo 3DS, and then later on, the Nintendo Switch. It then gained a sequel in the form of Age of Calamity , which told a story based on the period of time that's otherwise only reflected in flashbacks over the course of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild .

With Hyrule Warriors: Age of Calamity having sold over four million units, and the Switch 2 selling very well for Nintendo, it's likely that Age of Imprisonment will see a similar or greater level of success. This is just the latest game Zelda fans have been able to look forward to over the last few years, with Tears of the Kingdom landing in 2023, Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom arriving in 2024, and now Age of Imprisonment releasing on November 6, 2025. It remains to be seen if Nintendo has more Zelda projects planned further out to maintain this annual streak, however.

Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment

item.title: How to Complete A Vassal Lost in Hollow Knight Silksong
item.description:
Hollow Knight: Silksong players who complete the game (or press Up, Down, Up, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right on the Extras menu) will unlock a special permadeath mode. Other than losing all of one's progress when Hornet dies, Steel Soul mode plays out much the same as a regular playthrough, only with two major differences.

The first is that the Dead Bug's Purse is replaced by the Shell Satchel due to the former only being useful if and when Hornet dies. The other is a secret Hollow Knight: Silksong side quest called A Vassal Lost, which can only be triggered in Steel Soul mode and rewards players with some additional lore and an incredibly useful item.

How to Start A Vassal Lost in Hollow Knight: Silksong

To start A Vassal Lost, players will need to make their way to the cave on the far eastern side of the Blasted Steps. Once there, they'll see an NPC called Steel Seer Zi, although they won't be able to talk to her right away. Instead, they'll need to hit her to wake her up, after which, the Speak prompt will appear. They can then speak with Steel Seer Zi twice to accept her Wish. As mentioned above, A Vassal Lost can only be triggered while playing Silksong on Steel Soul mode.

How to Complete A Vassal Lost

To complete A Vassal Lost, players will need to inspect three spots on the map. One is at the top of Bone Bottom above the path leading into Shellwood, one is in the Putrified Ducts to the east of Fleatopia, and one is in Far Fields, southeast of Pilgrim's Rest. The locations of all three are marked clearly on the player's map once they've promised the Wish, and they'll be free to visit them in any order they like. After inspecting the third camp, they'll be directed back to Bone Bottom and a secret cave just to the west of Bonegrave.

Inside the cave, players will find Steel Seer Zi's Vassal, who is attempting to summon a nightmarish creature from the void. Sadly, Hornet arrives too late to stop them, forcing players to square off against the Summoned Saviour. Thankfully, this is a relatively simple fight when compared to some of the other boss fights in Silksong, with players only really needing to worry about its projectiles, which affect the area immediately in front of and beneath it. Assuming they can dodge these effectively, they shouldn't have too much trouble.

A Vassal Lost Side Quest Rewards

After defeating the Summoned Savior, players should speak with the Vassal again and then return to Steel Seer Zi in the Blasted Steps. She'll thank Hornet for her help and then reward her with an item called the Growstone . The Growstone is a consumable item that rewards players with Shell Shards. However, unlike most of the other consumables in Silksong , the Growstone will regenerate over time, allowing players to reuse it once enough time has passed.

item.title: Best Games With Dudes In Distress
item.description:
A lot of players who grew up in the 80s and 90s were probably accustomed to rescuing characters like princesses from evil villains. Super Mario Bros. is a good example, as Mario was looking for Princess Toadstool, who later became Princess Peach. It was a common trope in other media, too, but over the years, there has been a revolution in the damsel in distress trope.

There have been games, shows, and movies wherein there are males in trouble. This trope could be funnily called dudes in distress. It doesnt necessarily have to feature female heroes saving male characters, but its a common part of the story. Either way, these games are great.

Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddys Kong Quest

DKs Kidnapping

Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest
Platformer
Systems
9.3 /10
Released
November 21, 1995
ESRB
e

Powered by

Donkey Kong Country was a massive hit on the SNES that helped revive Donkey Kong as a character. It only seemed right to make a sequel, but Rare was seemingly not satisfied with just another DK adventure. Instead, Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddys Kong Quest put Diddy Kong in control, who had to rescue DK from pirates. They also added a new Kong, Dixie, who was definitely the MVP.

Diddy controlled like the previous game, but Dixie could use her hair to glide around levels, making the tricky platforming sections easier. The game also added more to the gameplay, like collectible coins that could unlock areas and prizes. Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddys Kong Quest is a great sequel, and many fans appreciate it as the best in the series.

Final Fantasy 10-2

Where Is Tidus?

Final Fantasy X-2
9.2 /10
Released
November 18, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Final Fantasy 10-2 is the franchises first direct sequel to a mainline game and featured returning cast members Yuna and Rikku, along with newcomer Paine. After receiving a mysterious video of what looked like Tidus trapped in a prison, Yuna assembles her squad of girls to solve the case. Gameplay is similar to the previous game, except this time the characters can switch jobs during turn-based combat via Dresspheres.

The tone has also shifted from a dour pilgrimage to a more happy-go-lucky adventure despite Tidus seemingly in danger. Locations are less sprawling, but there is still plenty to explore as the game reuses nearly every asset.

The Legend Of Zelda: Echoes Of Wisdom

Absorbing Links Power

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom
25
8.9 /10
Released
September 26, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom gave fans what they wanted for years: a Zelda game that actually starred Zelda as the main character. Players begin with Link, but after a dungeon run, he gets sucked into another world and is unable to leave. Zelda then gets a mysterious rod that she can use to clone objects and monsters and use them as she sees fit, such as stacking tables to reach a hard-to-reach cliff and sending out swarms of birds to tackle other enemies.

Though The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is a top-down game, it offers a large map packed with things to do, like a true open-world experience. Zelda could also learn to channel Link to learn his powers, like using his sword, in temporary states while she attempted her rescue mission.

River City Girls

Well Take The World On And Sing This Dope Song

River City Girls
Beat 'Em Up
Systems
Released
September 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Blood, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

River City Girls was a great revival for the series, which led to one sequel so far. It starred the girlfriends of Kunio and Riki from the Kunio-kun series, Misako and Kyoko. As told in the animated intro, cut with a dope song, Kunio and Riki are thrown into a van, and then Misako and Kyoko have to get them back.

They prove to be equally tough as their beat em up boyfriends as they punch and kick their way through the titular city. They can level up as they pound baddies and learn special moves at shops. Its a great modern brawler, and the sequel lets players be Kunio and Riki, along with some new characters.

Spelunky 2

Pow Ana, Straight To The Moon

Spelunky 2
9 /10
7.0 /10
Released
September 15, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Spelunky 2 is a direct sequel to the first game, taking place many years later. During this time skip, the previous hero, Guy, marries Tina and has a child, Ana. When Tina and Guy go to the moon to explore a new set of ruins, they disappear and leave Ana behind.

As Ana, players can explore the moons many dungeons. Gameplay is just as difficult as the original since players have to watch their step as they explore the ever-changing roguelike dungeon. Its not specifically a dude in distress game, as the mom, Tina, is also missing, but it still works.

SteamWorld Dig 2

A Rusty Adventure

SteamWorld Dig 2
8.0 /10
Released
September 21, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

SteamWorld Dig 2 takes place a little after the first game, wherein its hero, Rusty, has now gone missing. A young female robot, Dorothy, is determined to find and rescue Rusty no matter the cost. Like the previous game, players will be stationed in a hub town, wherein they will dig below the surface and then return to offload loot and fill up on water.

Without water, Dorthy cannot act. SteamWorld Dig 2 is also a Metroidvania, as Dorothy will gain new exploration powers like bombs to blow up harder minerals and a hookshot to cross gaps. It is a bigger and better game in every conceivable way.

Super Princess Peach

An Emotional Journey

Super Princess Peach
Platformer
Fighting
Action
Adventure
Systems
Released
October 20, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Princess Peach is a damsel in distress in most Mario games, so it only seemed fitting that she got her own spinoff via Super Princess Peach . Koopa Troopas kidnap Mario, whisk him away to an island, and Peach is not far behind. She gets a magic umbrella that she can use to attack enemies and glide around stages.

Peach also gets four emotional powers that players can activate on the bottom screen of the DS. Her sadness, for example, will get her to cry, which will in turn help her run faster as she spews huge streams of tears. These tears can help solve puzzles like growing plants players can then use to platform into. It was a weird setup to be sure, but a good Mario spinoff on the DS overall.

item.title: More Game Boy Advance Games Are Coming to Nintendo Switch Online
item.description:
Retro video games continue to see a major resurgence thanks to subscription gaming services, with Nintendo confirming that the next wave of Game Boy Advance titles will be available to Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pass subscribers beginning September 25. The Nintendo Switch Online Nintendo Classics lineup provides subscribers with the opportunity to experience dozens of old-school titles on modern consoles, and the next update will include surprising entries from two unsung classic franchises.

Nintendo has previously released a number of NES, SNES, and even N64 games for Nintendo Switch Online, with these gaming libraries officially named the Nintendo Classics collection. For fans who have enjoyed the existing catalog of retro titles, the upcoming addition of two more Game Boy Advance games will offer the unexpected chance to relive the adventures of two lesser-known yet still iconic heroes of retro gaming.

Game Boy Advance Games Coming to Nintendo Switch Online on September 25

  • Klonoa: Empire of Dreams
  • Mr. Driller 2

Beginning on September 25, 2025, Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pass subscribers will be able to jump into the throwback worlds of Klonoa: Empire of Dreams and Mr. Driller 2 . Klonoa: Empire of Dreams is the fourth game in the beloved platforming adventure series and is one of several spin-off games. Unlike the mainline entries in the franchise, Empire of Dreams features fully 2D side-scrolling gameplay following a side-story to the main Klonoa console games. Mr. Driller 2 is a block-breaking puzzle game with multiple single-player modes and a two-player versus mode. Despite not being the biggest sellers on the Game Boy Advance, both Klonoa and Mr. Driller have remained beloved by fans of old-school gaming, with many now looking forward to their resurrection on Nintendo Switch Online.

Just a week before the reveal of Klonoa: Empire of Dreams and Mr. Driller 2 , Nintendo also announced the release of Virtual Boy for Nintendo Switch Online, which will be coming in 2026. As the Nintendo Classic library continues to expand with surprising titles, including the shocking Virtual Boy reveal, many players are keeping their fingers crossed for even more big-name retro revivals and the inclusion of smaller classic games in the future.

Despite not having the biggest impact upon their initial launch, the inclusion of games like Klonoa: Empire of Dreams and Mr. Driller 2 for Nintendo Switch Online allows both older and younger players to experience a dose of nostalgia from the old-school era of gaming. Whether the two upcoming Game Boy Advance additions are any indication of future releases for Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion pass remains to be seen, so interested fans may want to follow along for any future announcements on more games coming to the NSO catalog.

item.title: Pokemon GO Reveals New Dynamax Debut in September 2025 Event
item.description:
Pokemon GO has revealed that Dynamax Duraludon will debut in an event starting on September 30. After years of waiting, Pokemon GO introduced the highly anticipated Dynamax and Gigantamax forms during Max Out Season, further increasing the number of critters for players to add to their collections.

Duraludon is a Pokemon with a dinosaur-esque design and a body made of powerful, resistant metal. To evolve, the Gen 8 monster must be exposed to a hunk of Metal Alloy, turning into Archaludon, a strangely designed Pokemon that looks like a bridge combined with a stapler. While Pokemon GO features several pocket monsters from the Gen 8 games, such as Falinks, Eternatus, and Morpeko, Duraludon was notably absent. Now, Duraludon is on its way to the augmented reality game.

Upcoming Pokemon GO Event Adding Dynamax Duraludon

Pokemon GO has announced the Steel Skyline event, which will mark the debut of Dynamax Duraludon in the game. The event will begin on Tuesday, September 30, at 10 am and end on Tuesday, October 7, at 8 pm local time. During these days, Pokemon GO players will encounter Dynamax Duraludon in four-star Max Battles, with it potentially appearing in its Shiny form. In addition to it, players will battle Dynamax Drilbur and Dynamax Rookidee in one-star Max Battles, and Dynamax Beldum in three-star Max Battles.

  • Date: Tuesday, September 30, at 10 am to Tuesday, October 7, 2025, at 8 pm local time
  • New Pokemon: Dynamax Duraludon (can be shiny)
  • Global Challenges
    • Work with Trainers around the world to complete Field Research tasks and complete throwing-based challenges to unlock bonuses for all to enjoy Once a challenge is completed, special bonuses will be unlocked for the remainder of the event and the next Global Challenge will begin.

  • Level 1 Rewards
    • Additional Candy for successfully catching Pokemon with Nice, Great, and Excellent Throws

  • Increased chance for Trainers level 31 and up to receive Candy XL for catching Pokmon with Nice, Great, and Excellent Throws
  • Level 2 Reward
    • Additional 5,000 XP from winning raids

  • Level 3 Rewards
    • One guaranteed Rare Candy XL from winning in-person Max Battles

  • Wild Encounters
    • Alolan Diglett*
    • Magnemite*
    • Grimer*
    • Alolan Grimer*
    • Porygon*
    • Aron*
    • Bronzor*
    • Trubbish*
    • Klink*
    • Axew*
    • Togedemaru*
    • Galarian Meowth*
    • Skarmory*
    • Mawile*

  • Max Battles
    • One-Star Max Battles
      • Dynamax Drilbur*
      • Dynamax Rookidee*

    • Three-Star Max Battles
      • Dynamax Beldum*

    • Four-Star Max Battles
      • Dynamax Duraludon*

  • Field Research Task Rewards
    • Event-themed Field Research tasks will be available. Complete Field Research tasks to earn encounters with event-themed Pokemon. Chance of a encounter with Dynamax Duraludon.

  • Free Timed Research
    • Rewards include the following:
      • One Magnetic Lure Module
      • XP
      • Stardust
      • Encounters with event-themed Pokemon
      • And more

  • The tasks associated with this Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before Tuesday, October 7, 2025, at 8 pm local time.
  • Paid Timed Research
    • Price: $1.99
    • Where to get: in-game

  • Rewards include the following:
    • Max Particles
    • Stardust
    • Encounter with Dynamax Duraludon
    • And more

  • The tasks associated with this Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before Tuesday, October 7, 2025, at 8 pm local time
  • Steel Skyline Ultra Ticket Box
    • Price: $1.99
    • Where to get: Pokemon GO Web Store
    • Comes with: an event ticket and three Golden Razz Berries

  • *Can be shiny

The Steel Skyline event will feature Global Challenges, with players from around the world working together to complete Field Research tasks to unlock three levels of bonuses for everyone. Togedemaru, Galarian Meowth, Skarmory, and 10 other Pokemon will have increased spawn rates, while new Field Research tasks and a free Timed Research will be available. Trainers will be able to purchase a $1.99 Research in-game that will reward them with goodies like Max Particles and encounters with Dynamax Duraludon. The Pokemon GO Web Store will sell a $1.99 Ultra Box with an event ticket and three Golden Razz Berries.

Part of September's events have already passed, but Pokemon GO has even more in store for players in the coming days. On September 20-21, Shadow Groudon will be the highlight of the upcoming Shadow Raid Weekend, and for the first time, its Shiny Shadow form will be available in the game. Dudunsparce and Mega Camerupt will debut in events taking place on September 23 and September 28, respectively. The critter featured on October Community Day is already confirmed, while Mega Metagross will be added to Pokemon GO on October 4.
